Reviews.Title: “Not bad, great location”
Reviews.Author: JackPMG
Reviews.Content: The staff were very nice. My room (43, on the top floor) was big enough for me and was clean and nice. Bathroom was a bit old but I can't really complain. There was noise, especially in the morning around breakfast time. It kept me from sleeping in which was annoying - but then I shouldn't really be sleeping in while on holiday. The Wi-fi was expensive, and only worked 50% of the time in my room. When I went down to reception to show them the issue it worked fine. I'm guessing the router is on the ground floor, so the upper levels don't get the best coverage. The location of this hotel is amazing! It's down a quite street, but literally a 3 minute walk to a bustling central square. Couldn't be better!

Reviews.Title: “If you would consider a B&B suitable this should do you fine”
Reviews.Author: Bristol_D-Man
Reviews.Content: Some quirkiness, not the absolute highest standards, but that was not an issue for us. Basically a very old house converted into a hotel (B&B really). Helpful staff, the classic 'amsterdam gap' under all the doors not helping sound insulation (tip: use a towel if the noise bothers you) Does have a lift, most rooms (our group used 6 of them) seemed OK mostly with minor faults we could overlook. Good location. Those who must have certain options like coffee/tea in the rooms or a plentiful supply of specific foodstuffs at breakfast should check that out before travelling IMHO as nothing is a given in a small hotel / B&B like this. Seasoned travellers who want the compromise of a decent priced room yet still in a good location will be very familiar and hopefully comfortable with the style and quality of this sort of establishment. As long as you are not expecting the Hilton you should be happy with the Prinsen.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: jaycar98
Reviews.Content: Appalled when went to our room. So small we and our ( not oversized ) luggage could not fit. Basin in room. bed pushed against wall. How do you get out? Refused room and moved to another. Pleasant enough stay. Good breakfasts. Very disappointed not to have tea and coffee making facilities. This required us to get hot water from Starbucks and carry back to hotel. Not really hot when we got back but best we could do. Very clean. Great location. Staff a bit withdrawn. Wi Fi expensive and inconsistent pricing depending on who was on duty. Would stay again but don't accept room 44!

Reviews.Title: “Does its job well”
Reviews.Author: milanovictraveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights, I was impressed when I came in to find the some of the staff helpful. I was on the ground floor which suited me as I had a big suitcase. The room was nice, very quaint, tv was good with loads of diffrent channels, the bathroom was great, clean, big. The hotel is around the corner from Vondel Park. Public transport is very close, you can get a tram to most of the tourist areas or a bus. I was a little disappointed with the breakfast as it was cold meats, boiled eggs, fruit and tomatos. The staff were mostly good there were the 2 on in the morning that I had a problem with, 1 of them was just a pain in the butt that I avoided when coming out and then other 1 was rude and arragont. There is a cat who lives in the hotel, he doesn't go into rooms but you'll see him most morning when breakfast is on, he's a friendly little fellow who just wants a scratch, his name is Mr Spencer.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly helpful and knowledgable staff”
Reviews.Author: fussyfemaleKent
Reviews.Content: Arrived to a very friendly welcome and the staff were knowledgable and helpful. Hotel warm and in a very good location within a few minutes walk of Leidseplein where there are numerous bars and restaurants. We particularly enjoyed "The Pantry". Also within walking distance to a lot of the attractions. This hotel appears to be a traditional dutch building and I had e-mailed to request high floor room, which had been confirmed, but then on arrival had been allocated a room on the ground floor in what appeared to be an extension and compact in size but perfectly acceptable for the price paid. Unfortunately, soundproofing not good and every time a door was opened or closed or someone went up or down stairs the noise travelled and unfortunately I am a light sleeper. My husband slept ok so if you are a sound sleeper it won't bother you.The bed was comfortable and shower worked well with plenty of hot water. Continental breakfast perfectly adequately. An enjoyable weekend and we saw the ice racing on the canels - the first for fifteen years!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly warm hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: bernie-1040
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a quiet location but within walking distance of the LEIDESPLEIN where there are bus and tram stops and various bars, cafes and restaurants. The staff were friendly and helpful. The building was kept lovely and warm (it was around -10 while I was there). The beds were very comfortable. There was a great choice for breakfast and plenty to eat. The room was a good size with a good bath/shower and plenty of hot water. For a three star it was good value for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby”
Reviews.Author: s-bartfast
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the previous recent reviews were from but it's not the place I stayed in! This a shabby hotel with dirty corridors. Very basic rooms with zero sound insulation. Don't go expecting sleep before everyone gets home around 0100 or starts getting up at around 0700. This is a poorly converted set of classic Dutch narrow houses - plasterboard is not enough! I tried 4 different rooms - all were the same and one smelled of human excrement coming up through the wet room drain hole. I asked for a quiet room with a bath and got a noisy room with a shower and that was as good as it got. Breakfast was OK, standard Dutch cold meats and cheese with some plastic croissants and coffee from a dispenser machine. I was working in Amsterdam and not partying therefore no alcohol to help pass out with. 3 nights with almost no sleep was not OK in any way.

Reviews.Title: “basic but very clean”
Reviews.Author: kezza122
Reviews.Content: room v small but everything was v clean,breakfast was nice but need mor croissants as goin down at 9-9.30 ther was neva any left 4 us l8er risers &was hopin 4 mayb a cuple of pastry choices 4 my sweet tooth boyfriend lol,overal was gud location &value 4 money &wud consider stayin again,thinkin of may if the dosh wil allow &the deal is rite x

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel with fab location.”
Reviews.Author: leightravelclub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights. Yes room was a bit basic and not huge. But it was adequate.Fairly basic breakfast, but again, adequate.Staff were wonderful. The location is fantastic. Head out the front door and turn left and you just keep going for all the major sights. Turn right when you exit the hotel and you head for the local scene. Shops restaurants bars etc. All in all, a good choice for a short stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ragrambo
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay here & to be honest the hotel (b&b) really was not too bad! As we spend most of the day sight seeing in Amsterdam the b&b was decent enough to stay in ( for all the time we spent there). The rooms are tiny but this is normal in Amsterdam. The location is great with everything you need within 5 mins walk. Breakfast was fine with a nice selection of meats but some nice pastry & more selection of breads would be nice ( just being picky). But overall We were happy & would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Travel and Sport hockey group's parents”
Reviews.Author: TravelandSport
Reviews.Content: The school group was accommodated at the Stayokey Vondelpark; the parents were at the Prinsen. This is what the parents had to say: Overall accommodation â€“ Not bad Check in â€“ Not bad Room quality â€“ Can improve Staff service â€“ Not bad Food â€“ Can improve Location â€“ Excellent They felt that there were many other hotels in the same area with cheaper rates.

Reviews.Title: “Very good - hard to beat on price and location.”
Reviews.Author: Ray M
Reviews.Content: Our group of 10 couples had a very enjoyable weekend stay at Prinsen at end of October 2011, and loved the hotel. Rooms were very comfortable and clean, although they are quite small you'll find this is the case with the majority of Amsterdam hotels at this price range. Breakfast is very good and provides a good choice. Hotel is ideally situated within a couple of minutes walking distance from Liedesplein Square on one side where you'll find a wide range of lively bars and decent restaurants and on the other side Vondelpark is also only a couple of minutes walk and is well worth a visit. The main central areas of Dam Square and Central Station are about 15 mins walking distance from hotel, but there's also a fantastic tram service from Leidesplein to Dam Square - we bought 48-hour tram tickets from the ticket office at Liedesplein for 11 Euros each, and found them to be great value allowing you to travel on any tram around Amsterdam. The tram service in general to all areas of the city is very good.Walking around was no problem, but it's also convenient to hop on and off the trams when you're pushed for time. Useful advice when walking around and crossing any street is to watch out for the bicycles - they're absolutely everywhere. When crossing roads, you'll always be looking out for cars and scooters as well as the trams, and tend to forget the bicycles so keep your eyes peeled for them. If you have time have a look around Rembrandt Square (just a few minutes from Dam Square) as that also has a good range of bars and restaurants, and try to make time to take in Museumplein (just a few minutes walking distance from Prinsen Hotel) and Waterlooplein. An absolute must is the Canal Boat Tour - get your tickets from the departure points at Central Station. Several options available, but we went for a 1.5 hour tour for 13 euros each -well worth doing and make sure you take a camera. We did this on our second day, but if you do this on your first day, it would give you a better idea of the layout of the city and landmarks. One last tip - on getting from Schiphol Airport to Prinsen Hotel (or any of the central hotels for that matter). If there's a few of you all with cases and bags, don't even bother with the train and tram option - just go for a pre-booked taxi. The Prinsen and other hotels recommend using www.schipholhoteltaxi.com and that firm offers a meet-and-greet option where they're waiting for you in the airport as soon as you arrive. We used this option, and booked it a few days before we travelled - at a cost of 47 Euros for 4 passengers, we thought that was reasonable and it meant we were at the hotel within half an hour of getting through luggage reclaim at the airport. On a weekend break when you're pushed time, means you can get checked in at the hotel and then get out exploring Amsterdam as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Parrots and comfy bedding.”
Reviews.Author: sedoyle
Reviews.Content: When i arrived at the Prinsen I was greeted by a friendly night clerk. At first I was dismayed that my room was to be in the basement, but he jollied me out of it, assuring me that the room looked out onto the pleasant courtyard garden. I did and watched the wild green parrots and the sparrows compete for food in the morning. The room was very very narrow but included everything necessary to comfort, especially the downy bedding and the little table and chairs. The fixtures were a little funky, but it was clean. Upstairs there is a great morning room for breakfast overlooking the garden. The spread was nice - lots of cured meats, hard boiled eggs, rustic breads and croissants, and yogurt and granola. Good fruit and juices. I did enjoy the management, who gave me directions, advice and sold me a seltzer water and ice late at night Friendly and unpretentious. A place to buff your shoes in the lobby. Good value, good location for museum hounds and shoppers alike. Price not bad at all for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel, a little basic but the price was not too bad”
Reviews.Author: tszil
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with friendly, helpful staff. The beds were not the most comfortable and the fittings and bathrooms, whilst clean, were basic. That aside, for the price it is a good place to stay, especially for the Museum quarter

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Difficult Owner”
Reviews.Author: FloridaEsther
Reviews.Content: My sister and I started our European vacation in Amsterdam, before embarking on a River Cruise down the Rhine. The Prinsen was on a beautiful, quiet street and within walking distance of the big museums. The room was extremely small for two adults, but we have come to expect that in Europe. We had a small balcony and in order to open the balcony door, we had to put one of the side chairs on the bed!! We still laugh about that. The bad part was the owner was very stingey. I like to use two towels for my shower and we asked him for an extra towel, we were told that this is not an American 5 star hotel and he only had a certain # of towels. Getting bar soap was even more difficult, so if you stay here, bring your own! On the other hand, the breakfast was good and rooms were clean. I would stay here again....just bring my own towel and soap!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Located & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: HertsCommuter
Reviews.Content: 57-bedroom hotel packed into a typically narrow Amsterdam building a short way south of Leidseplein and north of Vondelpark. We stayed in the only 'family' room which was in the lower ground floor (basement) down some pretty steep stairs (but there was a lift). We received a very warm welcome and were shown local places of interest on the complimentary map. As a hotel it was entirely adequate for our needs. It does not set out to be a luxury hotel, so think of it more as a guest house. The price included breakfast, which was one of the reasons we chose this hotel. Breakfast was continental buffet-style. Seating is limited, which probably explains the 7.30 - 10.00 window for breakfast. We only used the hotel for sleeping and breakfast, so we didn't place too many demands on it. Its central location in a quiet street was ideal, and it had a nicely-kept small garden at the rear, although as this was used by smokers we only used it when there were not any there.

Reviews.Title: “Rude and expensive terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: marqcertz
Reviews.Content: We were asked to pay upfront when we arrived (should have ringed alarm bells) We have booked a non-smoking room with 2 single beds and when we arrived we saw 2 pillows on a slightly wide single bed. We went down to see the manager (?) (only one person at the counter and he is not in uniform) and he was annoyed (already!?) but he found out that it was their mistake and so gave us another room We went to the second room and found a small room with two single bed in it (that room is probably more suited as a single room) but we can smell cigarette smoke in the room. we went back down to the reception and told him about the situation and he has this excuse that he cannot ensure the guest not smoking in a non-smoking room (i thought hotels should have policies for this) and said if we are not happy with the room there is nothing he can do and he cannot refund us (we haven't asked for a refund yet, so interesing, now we understand the pre-payment, and does he annoy customers so much that he has to pre-empt a refund) we told him that if the hotel cannot provide a service that we paid for then a refund will be reasonable . he kept on saying no blah blah and said he is not changing our room again (again? the first change was the result of the hotel's fault in the first place) and he essentially shown us the door ("if you are not happy, there is the door" to quote what he said) my female travel companion is visibly upset. we have this unpleasant exchange for about 10 minutes, and then he was able to miraculously find another room (wow magic, if he did this earlier it would have been so much nicer) we went to the room and found well it was ok, the bathroom got hair from the previous occupant but it is a tiny room with two single beds that we asked for. by then we were so upset about the whole experience we have decided that we won't be staying there and so we found another hotel and essentially left Prinsen hotel. and yes Prinsen hotel got paid for nothing but i don't care, i didn't even feel safe to stay in the hotel after all those unpleasant exchange. to cap it off is when i went down to the reception after the last room change for the use of internet (we had to pay for it obviously) he asked is everything ok now (yeah right - but i said it's ok) and then he said "now you are welcome in the hotel" what? now i am welcome? as if it is our fault? sorry i don't feel welcome at all Don't stay in Prinsen hotel. you can get much nicer hotels with better staff on the same street with essentially the same price. and if you are willing to pay a bit more you will be able to get something really nice (like 5 star!) it is a so called three star hotel but really where do the stars come from? i would say it is a one star at most with a four star hotel price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the best place for business”
Reviews.Author: OlivierRomand
Reviews.Content: Been there with a colleague of mine for couple of nights. The location is definitely nice, right in the center and quiet street but the quality of the rooms isn't that great: Two beds put together in a single person room (ok, Amsterdam isn't famous for having wide spaces but still). The window wasn't closing bringing fresh air and noise during the night. The staff isn't really helpful either, though the quality of the breakfast is "ok". Not great but ok. Because of the many tourist in Amsterdam, the quality hasn't probably changed since 20-30 years. Surprise to be directed to Mc Donald to get a free wifi ... in 2010 !! And again the staff to be surprised to be asked a toothbrush because I forgot mine. Even though this is anecdotal, this still reflects the poor quality of the service. For small budget this is probably worth .. but you won't have to mind about the poor quality of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Halpful and friendly staff, room OK...”
Reviews.Author: Droidski
Reviews.Content: The Prinsen Hotel is a really friendly hotel just a stones throw from the fantastic Vondel Park and Leidseplein with its dozens of bars and eateries. Our double room was a little small but clean with a good bathroom/shower and the staff were really friendly and keen to help out with advice and directions. The breakfast buffet was good with plenty of choice and overall I'd recommend it to anyone wanting a reasonably inexpensive stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel in a Great location.”
Reviews.Author: marcusba_555
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here once before about 13 years ago and was again delighted with the location ,being so close to Leidesplein.The hotel is not expensive for a 3 star hotel and although the rooms are not very big they are always clean and well presented with everything one needs especially for a short break..I would however not recommend staying in the single rooms as they are quite small.The staff are very helpful and friendly and the breakfast great.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WeeBillWestLothian
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and got it through airmiles. Hotel staff were nice enough. We ended up staying an extra night because our flight got cancelled due to the ash cloud! Breakfast was good. Rooms a little small but everything you needed. In a good location. Overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Demoritus
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family ( 2 adults + 2 children) for 3nights in a Quad room. From day one we had some problems with the electricity in our room....the electric connection kept tripping as and when we used the bathroom. The Hotel staff blamed some kind of Humidity in the bathroom for this tripping?????? For 2days we had this problem...but the hotel made no extra effort to fix it.... My kids feared entering the bathroom...as we could see some spark before the lights would go off. The only thing the hotel staff did was....feeling sorry for us......which was not good enough. On the third day we were told the problem is fixed....but I guess it was too late to change our impression about the service levels. I'm not sure how the hotel handles some emergencies during Night time.....as there is only one staff on night duty.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay - great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sahra_J75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Prinsen 2-5th March 2010 with my friend. Friendly and informative staff on reception. Hotel situated in lovely quiet street but right next to Leidesplein and could walk quickly to Rembrant Sq and not to far to Dam Square on foot. Room compact, but as a regular visitor to Amsterdam can say this is a regular feature due to building architecture. Room was clean and warm and had a balcony, linen and towels all nice and fresh. Beds were REALLY soft but after a long day walking nice to sink into after a long hot bath. Water piping hot at any time of day. Breakfast continental style with a reasonable choice for a few days stay. Restaurant staff helpful and polite. Had a great stay in this hotel and would return on any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet part of the city”
Reviews.Author: JRH_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights at the Prinsen, it was booked through Air Miles, and recomended by them. The hotel itself is in a good position near the beautiful Vondel park and not far from the Rijkmuseum, Coster Diamonds ( well worth a visit) also only a five minute walk to the canal system and the cruises boats. Breakfast at the hotel was plentyful, taken over looking the garden. The rooms, whilst not big were clean and bright, we also had a bath and two showers, our room overlooked the garden and was very quiet. The staff were very helpful, and I feel more than happy to reccomend this hotel to anyone thinking of visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, rooms OK but not always clean.”
Reviews.Author: maximus66
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was on the whole satisfactory. The plus points are the superb location - very close to pretty much all of the things you want to do in Amsterdam (within walking distance or within short tram ride) but in a surprisingly quiet and smart street. The friendly staff is helpful. Also the nice peaceful garden at the back. The room was OK in terms of size and view, but not always pristine in terms thoroughness of cleanliness. The carpet was quite dusty the whole time we were there. The en suite bathroom was OK, with a decent shower, but there was quite a bit of mildew from dampness, poor ventilation around the floor tiles and shower doors. The smell in the bathroom was never very fresh and I don't think the cleaning staff used bleach for cleaning the drains and bathroom units. A bit of bleach before check-in of new guests would do wonders! Also the breakfast - not very good, poor selection and very difficult to manoeuvre around the area as during the weekend the place was full and made the breakfast area difficult to move around for the self service continental breakfast (selection was three types of sliced bread, poor quality cold meats and cheeses which looked a bit tired around the edges. Boiled eggs and a very slow toaster. Orange juice, water, tea coffee, and two very basic types of cereal). After two or three days, you would get pretty tired of the selection. Having said all that, we were reasonably happy with our stay even though it was overpriced for what it was, but that could be because of the reasonable goodwill and good mood as we were on holiday. I certainly would not recommend it for business or family use if you have children. For adults travelling solo or as couples it is fine for a couple of days, but perhaps shop around and keep this hotel as a fall back option if you can't find a hotel within budget in the same location (which as I said is just about perfect)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and clean hotel in an excellent area.Rooms small but you only sleep in them!!”
Reviews.Author: LandDCheshire
Reviews.Content: Spent a lovely weekend in Amsterdam, our first visit.Hotel Prinsen is on a quiet tree lined road in an excellent location,close to all forms of transport,many restaurants and bars but away from the more "rowdy" areas of the city.When we went to our room we were shocked at the size,it should only have been a single.Went back to reception and were given the keys of 2 more rooms to choose from, one was the same as the first but the other was acceptable.I must say that the room and bathroom were very clean and the bed was comfortable which is all you need after a long day exploring Amsterdam! Breakfast was good and the dining room waspleasant.All staff were polite and helpfulI I would rate this hotel as very good for a short break. I like staying in nice hotels but to me the most important thing is cleanliness and I had no complaints on that score.As I always research on the net before going on one of our city breaks,I found the links on the hotels own web site very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Buzzards
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a weeked in Amsterdam. We enjoyed our stay at the Prinsen, the location is excellent, near to the centre but set back in a quiet side road. The staff were extremely friendly and the breakfast fresh, plentiful and delicious. Okay, the rooms are on the small side, but the beds are comfy and clean. At the end of the day most people are in Amsterdam for a city break and do not spend a lot of time in their hotel room so as long as it's got a bed and is comfy and clean I don't have a problem. We would definately go back and really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel at a fantastic location with good service”
Reviews.Author: ajaxmar
Reviews.Content: We have not like the previous revieuw had a bad experience with the prinsen hotel. We had a wonderful stay at a good location with nice staff to help us with everything. Even if we had some small remarks it was resolved immediately when we asked. It is a pitty that they did not complain in the hotel but on this page. WE can only say we love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “i was probably unlucky”
Reviews.Author: phibi
Reviews.Content: Maybe i was just unlucky but... when i arrived they gave me a room which hadn't been clean... i left my things and went out... when i came back the receptionist told me that i had left the door of the room open.. i'm sure i didn't that means that who cleaned the room left it open... fortunately, i had all my importand stuff with me so nothing was stolen... then the night i realized that in front of my window (i mean like 50 cm) there was a lamp that illuminated the street. in my room was daylight... i just had curtains to screen light and even not dark... i slept because i was really very tired but the light was really too much... then another problem were the walls... you could hear everything... (imagine a hotel frequentet mainly by young people, coming back after a night in coffe shops...) at one point the noise was so loud that i thought somebody entered in the room... the price is ok, not as high as the other hotels in amsterdam, and it's also near the centre town. it's not really a quite hotel, i'd advice it only to young people... but i repeat maybe i was just unlucky with the room position.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful rooms”
Reviews.Author: EsotericKent_UK
Reviews.Content: clearly some people have very low standards. We travel a fair bit and Ive had small rooms before in cities, but well done. These were minute and awful (circa 1978). Put it like this, I couldnt get to the wardrobe without climbing over the bed and it was impossible to turn around in the bathroom. Not sure how they actually got a double bed in it. The bed was hugely uncomfortable and decor was old and tatty. TV didnt work. If it was really cheap-say Â£60 a night then I would have put up with it but it was over â‚¬120 a night. The woman was also very unfriendly and we had to pay in full before we even saw the room as we checked in. As the reception area is quite pleasant we did so. Never again till I see a room. They also the day before we arrived had taken a nights deposit on my card (which i didnt know) and then proceeeded to charge us for the full nights when we were there. It took me 12 days to get this extra night back on my card. They refused when i called them to phone up and knock off the extra nights authorisation. Breakfast boring (hence went out after the first day) and served by someone desparate to clear my plate as fast as I ate. I rarely complain about anywhere, indeed usually leave good reviews but this place took the biscuit.-a thoroughly joyless place and presumably could only be liked by people who had never stayed anywhere reasonable but well done. Loved Amsterdam though and despite the hotel had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for quality”
Reviews.Author: AJWSomerset
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in Oct 08 and first impression of the hotel were good. It was situated in a quiet residential street very close to Vondel Park and close to good restaurants and cafes. We were directed to a basement level room, number 8 which was the smallest hotel room I have ever seen. You need to expect small rooms in Amsterdam but this I would describe as claustrophobic. There were two tiny single beds and the bathroom had just enough room to stand in. The decor was quite poor and there was a hole punched in through the plaster above one of the beds. We asked straight away for a move and the receptionist let us see room 10 next door which was the same size but a slightly better layout. We decided to take this room as there was no other choice and thought it won't be bad as we would be out most of the time. We were awoke the following morning very early by the sounds of the dining room right above us and tables and chairs scraping so loud they could be heard through ear plugs! The bathroom ceiling was also covered in mildew. Like a previous reviewer I felt like checking out despite already paying up front but we managed to get a room on an upstairs floor for our second night which, was much better, light and airy but still small. I will point out that the rooms were clean but I am not sure that the health and safety hazard of blocking fire escapes with laundry trolleys would go down well with the fire service. Breakfast was cramped, especially Sunday morning but the waitress did set us up a space at the bar which was not easy but better that waiting around. Overall my opinion of the Prinsen is disappointing. This is the first time I have ever requested a room change at a hotel and my stay here had a negative effect on the weekend. I would not stay again nor recommend this hotel based on my experience. It was only 30 euros more than we paid to stay at the nearby Marriot.

Reviews.Title: “Prinsen is a prince”
Reviews.Author: Avrilmast
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Amsterdam and there were so many hotels to choose from, this was recommended by a friend who lives in Amsterdam for its convenience to most major attractions. The hotel is small & since space is such a premium in Amsterdam our room reflected this. However bedding and towels were spotless, bed was comfortable and it was quiet at night even though we had to sleep with the window open (no air conditioning). We were within a stonesthrow of the main bar and restaurant area and canal system. We recommend the waterbus which you can travel on all day (get on/off where you want). Don't miss Anne Frank museum though booking is advisable or you will queue for ages. The 'Red Light District' was fun to visit at night - an eye opener for me! There is so much to see and do in this city - the Prinsen was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “we enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: vaughanoff
Reviews.Content: Perfectly ok, small, family run hotel. All as advertised. Good location. Decent rooms. Note ; most Amsterdam hotel rooms are small !! Space here is at a premium. It's how they do it here . It's part of the scene. It's fine. Have a nice stay. I'm going back here next visit. Cheers V

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: Sue071
Reviews.Content: Very convenient - a tram ride away from Central Station, near a park, canal (with boat trips) Leidesplein and Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. We had a ground floor garden room which was clean and big enough with nice bathroom and TV (with BBC1 and 2). Very quiet except for noisy green parakeets which squawked from sunrise to sunset (and I'm a bird lover!). Large buffet breakfast. Helpful staff and lovely cat (Spencer).

Reviews.Title: “dissapointment”
Reviews.Author: PellyPoland
Reviews.Content: I checked the hotel's website out and it seemed very nice.....but when we got there what a disappointment! The rrom as small but lovely. The real problem was with the owner of this hotel. He was impolite. He told us " I kick you out" if you don't make this .... and that..... He treated us like we were his own property. He talked to much and not to the subject. I advise anyone to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “adequate but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: arlosmom
Reviews.Content: We booked the Prinsen Hotel through the room-finding service of the Tourist Office outside Centraal Station in Amsterdam. Upon arrival (about 11 AM) we were told the room would be ready at 2 PM, but we were welcome to store our luggage there until then. On our return we easily checked in (using the printouts the Tourist Office had given us). We were kind of dismayed at how small the room was. There was very little storage space, so we weren't able to unpack. Good features: very quiet, warm, clean, good breakfast, elevator, convenient to Leidseplein and trams. The downside: the very small room, and some of the reception staff were not overly helpful/knowledgeable. We thought overall the Prinsen was a bit overpriced for what we got, although we had no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: sheer
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff and a clean, bright, fresh room. Great breakfast and not over- crowded. Close enough to "All the action" but nice and peaceful for a quiet night's sleep. Very comfortable bed!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No probs at the prinsen!”
Reviews.Author: Topoff
Reviews.Content: Group of 5 of us stayed at the Prinsen, 1st - 3rd December 2007. Decided to book after reading the reviews on trip advisor. All in all was not disappointed in the slightest. Just a 5 minutes walk from the Leidesplein in a quiet street and located near the Marriott. Okay the bedrooms are fairly small but on a city break you only sleep there - They were both clean and comfortable. Breakfast was continental, ie eggs, ham, bread, cheese. Reception open 24 hours with a very small bar adjacent. The only slight complaint was the young chap behind the reception who seemed to be more interested in playing on the internet rather than helping us with any questions. Overall though would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good position, tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Manu1861
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week-end at the Prinsen Hotel in Amsterdam. We really appreciated its convenient position, close to the tram stop (3 lines to Dam/Central station, max. waiting time was 3 minutes) and in a very busy district, packed with restaurants and bars. The room was very quiet and overlooked a beautiful garden. The staff were generally kind and helpful. However, the room was very tiny, and the bathroom could have been cleaner. The breakfast was very basic, and it took ages to have a table cleared or get a cup of tea. We spent over 100 euros per night and we expected something better.

Reviews.Title: “What a dissapointment!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LifiNorthcliff
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent recommended this hotel. I also checked the hotel's website out and it seemed very nice.....but when we got there.....what a disappointment!!!!!!!!!!!! The room was so small, big enough for one person only. I suspect that they booked us into one of their single rooms for the price of a double room. (the photos on their website is VERY misleading) The mattres was worn out and very soft. Not suitable for a person with back problems. A VERY BAD odour was in the bathroom all the time and filled the bedroom if the bathroom door was left open. Sorry, I can't recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy!! I question the fact that this hotel is rated as a 3 STAR hotel!!!!????????? Dissapointed and misled South Africa

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: liver13
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel for 4 nights...what a lovely hotel in quiet surroundings... bed was the best we have ever slept in.... all amenities were excellent.... staff all very helpful... only to willing to help find your way around their beautiful city....... not far from leidesplein... with plenty of bars and cafes.... superb transport system.. everything all on time... will definitely visit again

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Prinsen”
Reviews.Author: perryScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and really enjoyed it. The room was a bit small but the really comfy bed made up for it. The staff really helpful and friendly. We enjoyed the breakfasts, but we did take our own travel kettle with us. It was so easy to find once we came off the tram, just a few minutes walk. We will go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “1st visit to Amsterdam - Good choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: seniormedsec
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Prinsen Hotel with my sister and my daughter. The weekend break was to help celebrate my sister's 'milestone' birthday. We shared a triple room on the third floor. It was light and airy, just big enough for the 3 of us, it was clean and looked well cared for. The bathroom was spotless. And the staff were all really friendly and helpful. We were pleasantly surprised how quiet the location was. But just around the corner it was all there for us. Everything we had come to Amsterdam to see. I would recommend this hotel in an instant and would certainly consider staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: nananix
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for this hotel I wondered what I had let myself in for.....I WAS IN FOR A TREAT ! This hotel is delightful. Typically tall slim dutch house on about 5 floors. Terrific location, easy for trams and only a 15 minute stroll into the centre of Amsterdam. Rooms were small but had everything to hand. A delightful balcony overlooked the tree lined quite road. The bathroom has a lovely large bath and is clean and bright. The breakfast was great. Staf really helpful. There is a safe in the bedroom wardrobe. This is free for your stay. All in all a great little hotel. Highly recommended. As I say the rooms are small but bright and clean. Hotel also provides toiletries in the bathroom. Cant wait to return and stay here again. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redhellewell
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Amsterdam after spending 3 nights at this hotel. I was a bit wary of what to expect after reading some of the reviews but on the whole this small hotel was more than adequate. Yes i agree the rooms are small but they were spotless as was the bathroom. The breakfast was lovely and plentiful. There was a smell near the downstairs loos but i had the room next to these and you could not smell anything once in your room and bear in mind you are right next to a canal?. Staff were helpful and approachable and couldn't do enough to help. the only disapointment was that there was no comfortable bar sitting area to have a drink after a long days walking. I would certainly stay there again in future and could recomend it as a base for a weekends stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatrickKB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Prinsen September 2005 on a business trip. This was for a trade fair, and lots of hotels were fully booked when I came to book. However, this one was not which, in hindsight, is not surprising. The room was tiny - the dreadful thing was that the walls were full of squashed flies and spiders. Really something I've never seen in a hotel. There was enough room to open the door, and get into bed. The bathroom smelled odd at times, but the tiling seemed recently renovated and was ok. Breakfast was ok, but all that was on offer was the cheapest kind of sliced bread and muffins with various toppings. I cut short my stay in this hotel and moved elsewhere, as it was so poor. I will never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “the rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went for a week away and i couldn't enter our bathroom because the smell was so terrible. The only time it smelt half decent was after a shower or a bath. The shower was a no go area aswell because every time you used it the floor got soaking wet! As you will know hotel rooms usually have a safe in. In may our safe was on the highest shelf in the wardrobe and therefore to access our belongings we had to stand on a chair.

Reviews.Title: “Went for my stag do. loved it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and 15 friends went to amsterdam for my stag do. we stayed at the prinsen. we stayed in a mix of 3 and 2 bed rooms. It was quite cheap, 50 euro per person per night for all rooms. Great location 5 mins from the leidesplein area. staff really friendly and a nice beer garden at the back. The rooms were tiny but we were only there to shower and sleep. The rooms were clean though. The breakfast was terrible (but thats continental breakfasts for you) and I brought a white towel with me that was taken by the cleaners (out of my case). For group bookings its brilliant. Dont think id go with just my fiancee/wife.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful city, terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: GraceManchester
Reviews.Content: Myself and My husband stayed at the Prinsen for 3 nights in march this year. The room was the tiniest room I have ever stayed in. You couldnt even sit fully on the loo or you would have hit your head on the wall. We couldnt stand up together in the room it was too cramped, my husband had to sit on the bed if I was getting dressed or anything. Absolute nightmare, on the plus side the staff were very friendly so if you dont mind staying in a room the size of a postage stamp, go for it. It is in an excellent location central to the heart of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Good For A Weekend Away!”
Reviews.Author: Jan69_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a group of girlfriends - hotel is in a fantastic situation - close to everything you could want, but also very quiet! The hotel rooms are small, but they are clean & comfortable. I've stayed in Amsterdam before & hotel rooms are small due to the narrow buildings - so if you like vast suites, it's probably not the city for you! Staff very friendly. Tax not applicable if you pay cash. Only thing I will say - proprieter moaned that we weren't paying enough as we'd been given week rates for a weekend stay - not our problem!

Reviews.Title: “Just the thing”
Reviews.Author: Yanni
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last year and would recommend it to anyone. At the time I was 17, visiting Amsterdam on my own for the first time, and was a bit nervous about what the hotel would be like, but I shouldn't have worried. On arrival I was greeted by friendly staff, willing to chat away to me in fluent english (as almost everyone does in Amsterdam). The room wasn't the biggest I've ever stayed in, but it was clean, tidy, and had everything I needed - a TV, safe, en-suite bathroom with shower, storage space, hairdryer and phone. The hotel serves a great breakfast every morning, included in the room price, which I thought was great. In terms of location it's perfect - a five minute walk away from Leidseplein, three minutes from the gorgeous Vondelpark, and close to all the major tram stops. Despite being so close to all the action, it's really quiet at night as the hotel is on a side street next to the park. If you're looking for a friendly, well-priced hotel right in the heart of Amsterdam, then go to this one -you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Prinsen Hotel at Amsterdam: Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a great city, it's very beautiful, those who don't know it should go there, you'll have a great time. Nevertheless, don't even think to book a room at Prinsen Hotel. Although it is very well situated, it is extremely expensive for the service they offer. I don't know how are the other rooms but the one where we have just spent 3 nights was really tiny and there was place for the bed only, not for the baggage, and we couldn't open the window at night for part of it remained over the bed. Unfortunately, there has been about 30ÂºC these days so we hardly could sleep at night. The only answer we got from the people at reception was that they felt hot at their homes as well. For such an unpleasant place we had to pay per night 125â‚¬ + city taxes (14% This tax is applied everywhere) + 4% (just because we paid with credit card, the only place in the whole city where we had to pay a plus), simply incredible!! Although Amsterdam is an expensive place, I think that better hotels can be found. Good luck and have a good time there!

HotelInfo.Name: Prinsen Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Vondelstraat 36-38, Amsterdam 1054 GE, The Netherlands
